reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek black display, dual time
reviews.author: Paul
reviews.content: This is one of Casio's best. I have two with the silver LCD displays, and one with the black. Black display is sleek and modern, but a bit harder to read, naturally, than the silver ones. But that's my choice -- in this case, fashion over function. Best part of this watch is the 24-hour DUAL TIME display function -- my second time is always set to GMT in 24-hour format, which I use for work every day. It's also extremely comfortable, lightweight, waterproof and tough. I literally wash it gently with soap and water after a long run or bike ride. Five stars overall -- value for money, function and durability. Caveat for the black display only; slightly harder to read.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2022

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just a really cool watch.
reviews.author: Shaka
reviews.content: I really like this watch. I like the simple and low profile of those old school Casio watches. No pretense, which is my style. As a diver, I wanted one that went down to 100m. So I paid a little extra this time for that feature. The black background and white digits is very unique and gives this watch a sleek look. I think it might be the only one that I've seen with that LCD setup. The only issue I have is when I go swimming it is difficult to nearly impossible to read with googles or masks that are tinted. I can read it well with my clear diving mask when I push the illumination button. But otherwise, I can't read it at all. I have to pull out my diving light which is no big deal. Or in a swimming pool, I will have to surface and remove my goggles to read it. I reckon this will not be a problem for most people, especially if you are purchasing this item based purely on its aesthetics as I basically did. It was too cool to pass up. And I am keeping it. I have the Casio solar power watch that I use instead when going in the water, as a back up to my dive computer. Or when I really need to watch my time in the pool, which is hardly never. I love my tinted and mirrored goggles, but for indoor pool use, I think I'd like a clear set anyhow. Or maybe not, pools at the gym can be disgusting. I also wish the screen was a bit more scratch resistant, but the pool I use in the gym has an almost sandpaper like surface to it, so I just flip my watch to the other side of my wrist to avoid contact with surfaces. I hope they keep this style as when this one dies out, I will definitely buy another one. One thing to look out for with these types of watches. They claim a ten year battery life, but somehow the alarm got activated for midnight everyday. I had to refer to the book to shut it off. It wasn't really a huge problem, but I was worried that it would shorten the battery life. You can apparently replace the battery. Tutorials are available on YT. Having worked on my diving computer, I would probably use some kind of silicone grease on the gasket to ensure water proofing.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sleek budget Casio
reviews.author: christian rambissoon
reviews.content: As is known, the negative display is hard to read in low light without using the backlight and I accept that. But overall verrrry happy with this watch. Its understated, lightweight, feature full and has great water resistance. It's perfect as a small outdoors activity watch; which is what I bought it for (beach, hiking etc). Didn't want to bulk up to a g-shock sized watch.

And it looks good as part of my uniforms and outfits.

Especially love the hourly and daily alarms. Glad I got prodded into making the purchase after some comparison shopping.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Black on black on slate black blazer
reviews.author: Travis Currier
reviews.content: I like inexpensive Casio watches and I've owned a bunch of the different models under $30.This one is among the coolest. I'm never ashamed to have it on my wrist and it goes with pretty much anything. The blacked out display is sick and I think it elevates the watch a bit (over a typical cheap Casio with a lighter display and colored lettering), I don't worry about it looking corny or cheap.Also, I use the dual time function to see my friend's time in China—not that the perfect 12-hour difference makes for very difficult math.. Cool option, though.The only thing I would change about this watch is the color of its buttons. I think they detract only slightly from the Black Out theme. I'd keep them metallic but maybe go black or gunmetal/charcoal for color.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Budget 007
reviews.author: Terry
reviews.content: It’s a nice watch for the money. It does look great since I replaced that flimsy plastic strap with the stainless Casio strap off my A168-3298. Everything works like it should however, I’ve only worn it around the house and I noticed about a million little scuffs on the face, this watch crystal will scratch most easily, just something to keep in mind. I really think Casio would do themselves and the consumer a tremendous favor by putting a real mineral crystal in rather than the soft cheap plastic one. This watch will not last even half of the 10 year battery life it came with without a mineral crystal. I would recommend this watch only because it’s cheap enough to be replaced often. Thanks.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight
reviews.author: Anon
reviews.content: Just received today, my old Casio of 6 years just broke so I immediately ordered this one to replace it, my old one was also a 15 dollar one from Walmart and was extremely reliable and durable but the band snapped off and I lost it so I expect to have this one for a long time as well. A couple of issues with this one I instantly noticed is it's too easy to bump into 24hr format and I don't like that the light only stays on for 1 second regardless if you hold the button down. My old one stayed on as long as you held the button. And lastly, the 10 year batt life is fine and I'll never have to worry about it but it's funny that in the manual it states that it's based on only using the lumination once a day. Anyway, I like the watch and glad I got it on sale.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2023

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great simple design, dim display
reviews.author: Mathias Weibel
reviews.content: This is a good watch with an unfortunate flaw that affects its usability. The display is difficult to read in sunlight or any high light condition, and the ‘LIGHT’ button doesn’t help—the backlight is too weak to do anything in normal daylight conditions. The backlight is perfect for checking the time in a dark sleeping bag/room/etc. without being too bright, but that makes it essentially useless during the day.Otherwise, it’s a good simple, discreet watch. Most watches have too much information, or not enough, or it’s displayed in a cluttered/confusing manner. This watch excels in the layout and presentation of info. It’s just hard to read in lots of normal lighting conditions.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 24, 2024

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Few issues but nice watch.
reviews.author: Travis pratt
reviews.content: First it’s much smaller than it looks in pictures, I’d recommend looking at the dimensions and comparing them with other watches as I was a little surprised how small it looks. However, the small size means it’s comfortable and very lightweight. I also don’t like the band, while it’s plenty long for me, the buckle sits on the outside of my wrist and creates a pressure point which I don’t like and on top of that causes the watch to rotate to the outside, just not a very good band for me, if you have a smaller wrist maybe it would be better but then again the band is so long that may be an issue for some. Then there’s the light, it lights up from the bottom corner and doesn’t illuminate evenly, not a huge issue but it’s much more noticeable in person than any pictures seem to show. Overlooking these gripes, it’s aesthetically pleasing, is generally comfortable, really lightweight and functions well.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2022

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a Casio
reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle
reviews.content: What I love the most about this watch is that it's simple and it just works. I have other watches, but this is what I use +90% of the time. It's been through a lot of abuse and salt water for more than a year and it just has a barely noticeable scratch on the screen. I didn't read the size (37mm) when buying it and thought it was a 40mm, so it's smaller than I expected, but that's on me (read thoroughly next time). The black on black looks great. The only real downside is that the backlight isn't that bright, but barely bright enough that you can recognize the numbers.

reviews.content: I used to have a watch like this one when I was younger and it brought up memories from those good old times.Started using it for construction because I'm always working against the clock and even though I always have a phone, my hands get muddy and I don't want to grab my phone with my hands full of mud and dirt.I get to check time and date for when I'm doing my paperwork so it's good for me.I did notice the screen catching more than a few scratches but it's hard not to when I'm doing construction.Definitely a good watch for the money.

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's Worth It
reviews.author: Somebody who knows
reviews.content: This is a dependable Casio.This is NOT a recent purchase review.I have had this watch for over 3 years.So far, it has survived:• Months of intense ocean rescue training• Bangs• Drops• Scratches• It's been stepped on• Deep freshwater• Deep salt water• Florida summer heat• So, SO much moreYes you can see the figures on the watch, though it took me some practice.All of the functions still work perfectly.My display is a bit scratched, but that is to be expected.The straps are highly adjustable. The piece that keeps your strap from flopping around did break a couple of months ago, so I replaced it. However, I haven't been "nice" to my watch, so I probably it coming.After a year and a half, I had to recalibrate the time by a minute or so.Yes, you will get the coolest compliments on your unique watch display.It's worth it. Ready for year four.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2022

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not a g shock. Don't treat this like a g shock.
reviews.author: kye
reviews.content: It's not a bad watch at all. Very readable, comfortable and light. It looks great, it's as functional as you would ever want in a basic function watch. A trusted brand, casio. Great battery life. But it didn't last more than a month for me. I been wearing g shock 24/7 for years. So I wanted to switch it up with a lighter casio. If you can avoid man handling, exercise or heavy labor then this watch is a good option.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2023
